6:
Gary Neville on Jurrien Timber being his ‘Player to Watch’ this season:

“Last season, I was looking forward to him coming to Arsenal & adding defensive stability to the squad. They did that anyway without him. I think the fact that he’s been out for so long, it will be interesting to see.”

“Obviously Arsenal haven’t made a lot of additions to their squad this year, so he feels like a new addition. I would just like to see him play & see how he fits in.” [Sky]
7:
𝐎𝐔𝐓 𝐎𝐅 𝐓𝐇𝐄 𝐁𝐋𝐔𝐄𝐒:
A FIT GABRIEL JESUS

The presence of Kai Havertz in the position of number 9 in Arsenal means that the Brazilian Gabriel Jesus has to find a solution within the team regarding his number

I think Bukayo Saka's side has no questions, the number is already "Locked" but the left side is the one throwing the shilling up (Martinelli, Trossard here I add Gaby Jesus) anyone can take it

I look at Jesus who is fit, I think he can be a very dangerous player for Arsenal if he comes from the left side

1: His dribbling especially in narrow areas (which means he can be a very good help against teams that are very low)

2: Pressing, Jesus has never been lazy on the field.. which means he improves even more the "Pressing Chain" of Arsenal: Jesus, Kai, Odegaard and Saka. 

3: Goals & Assists: Jesus can create space, with the last pass from him or the ability to take two players of the opposing team and create an open space in the other part of the field (he should also improve his finishing)

I think Jesus does not rely too much on runs of number 8 (leftsided 8) to have a big impact on the field, because his skillset is enough to be successful on the side of the field. 

If Arsenal get Gabriel Jesus who is 100% fit then they have another weapon in the field..

Your thoughts?
